sub_title: Global Director WRI Ross Center for Sustainable Cities
summary:
WASHINGTON (November 16, 2022) — WRI is pleased to announce that Rogier van den Berg has been selected to become the next Global Director of WRI Ross Center for Sustainable Cities.

“I am delighted that Rogier will head our cities program,” said Ani Dasgupta, President & CEO, World Resources Institute. “Rogier has been a leader in cities and urban design for his entire career. He brings tremendous experience, credibility and leadership to the role. Rogier has a clear vision to continue elevating our work in cities at this critical moment and the passionate energy to deliver it.”

"I look forward to combining research and action in cities to improve people's lives and combat the climate crisis through transformative change," said Van den Berg. "Working alongside the talented WRI Ross Center team and our partners, I am committed to ensuring that cities become equitable, resilient and low-carbon."

Van den Berg will lead a global team of 500 experts in urban planning, mobility, energy efficiency, resilience, water management and more. Through innovative research, deep engagement with urban leaders, and global partnerships, WRI Ross Center’s network of local and international experts puts cities on a trajectory toward more sustainable and equitable development. Staff are based in offices in Brazil, China, Ethiopia, India, Indonesia, Mexico, Colombia, Turkey, Europe and the United States.

“Rogier has already had a huge impact on WRI’s cities work in a short time,” said Adriana Lobo, Managing Director for Global Presence and National Action. “He has led the program globally with great success by bringing new projects, developing new areas of work, such as urban water resilience, and deepening our work in Africa. He has already worked in many of the countries where WRI is based so he really understands very deeply how to make change happen at the local and national level.”

Prior to joining WRI, van den Berg led UN-Habitat’s Urban Lab program, which rapidly expanded its scope to become a multidisciplinary urban project and integrated planning facility working in 80 cities globally. He was a founding partner of the architecture and urban planning firm Zandbelt & VandenBerg and also served as head of the Amsterdam Academy of Architecture’s Master of Urbanism program.

Van den Berg holds an Executive Master’s Degree in International Negotiation and Policymaking from the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies and a Master of Science in Architecture from Delft University of Technology.

profile_positions.title: Director Urban Development

profile_positions.description:
Set up and programme management of UN-Habitat's Urban Lab and Global Network of Urban Labs. The HQ Lab is located in Nairobi and is active in over 60 countries globally and provides assistance to cities and Member States in sustainable urban development through innovation driven processes. The Lab works with governments and the private sector to develop plans, programmes and policies in the area of Urban Planning, Climate Change, Technology, Resilience, (Post) conflict and displacement, Project Finance. Current partners include many local and national authorities, World Bank, Airbus, UNHCR, Green Climate Fund, Adaptation Fund, UK Foreign Office, Caribbean Development Bank, Dutch Enterprise Agency, Microsoft, Swedish Energy Agency.

Some recent engagements include:
Strategic Partner to the UK Foreign and Commonwealth Office, Future Cities Programme 2019-2022 in 19 cities, 10 countries; Turkey, Brazil, South Africa, Nigeria, Myanmar, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam. Implementing 30 transformational projects in the field of urban planning, transport, resilience, data and finance.

Expert and moderating team for the Dutch Water as Leverage programme; building resilience in 3 Asian cities in Bangladesh, Indonesia, India by developing transformative urban water projects with cities, private sector teams, communities and multilateral development banks

UN-UN collaboration with UNHCR including field work in Cox’s Bazaar, Mauretania and Kenya, Guideline Development for Urban Shelter and Settlement, advocacy and capacity building on humanitarian development nexus issues.

A selection of countries where the Lab is active: Singapore, Colombia, Mexico, Haïti, Brazil, South Africa, Ethiopia, Guinea Conakry, Sierra Leone, Rwanda, Ghana, Kenya, Somalia, Gaza, Egypt, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Afghanistan, Myanmar, China, India, the Philippines, Indonesia, China, Bangladesh.

profile_positions.description: SmartCityStudio was a think-tank and a blog, disseminating knowledge and advising local, regional and national governments and private sector industries on urban development, finance, technology, infrastructure, policies and partnerships. The company advised the High Level Group on Smart Cities of the Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment of the Netherlands, advised on urban redevelopment strategies in various Dutch cities. Advised Ministries on new approaches to data, technology and participation.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: For over ten years Zandbelt&vandenBerg has been at the forefront of Dutch architecture and urban planning. With an international portfolio, projects included master plans for cities, regional and metropolitan design, spatial economic strategies, neighbourhood design, airports, campuses and schools, cultural institutions, housing, public space design, private houses. The firm has been conceived as a innovation driven practice combining design expertise with an ongoing research on the city. Their work has been exhibited at the Architecture Biannual in Rotterdam in 2007 and 2012 and 'Villa in the dunes' has been published widely. Zandbelt&vandenBerg's publications on metropolitan planning in London, Paris, San Francisco, Port Transformations in Europe and Regional Design in the Netherlands have been widely distributed and acclaimed. After the office split up in 2013, Van den Berg continued the architecture practice with BERG + KLEIN. A boutique architecture, interior and design firm based in Nairobi and Rotterdam creating modern architectural designs with a strong sense of craftsmanship, materials and the landscape. Recent work, Villa H, has been featured among others on DOMUS, Dezeen, Archdaily. www.bergklein.com

profile_positions.description: The Amsterdam Academy of Architecture offers a Master education in architecture, landscape architecture and urbanism. As Head of the Department of Urbanism Rogier van den Berg has been responsible for the content of the curriculum, programme management, representation, maintaining (inter)national relations and setting up research programs and university networks. The Academy is well-known for its deel integration of the architecture, urbanism and lanscape architecture practice domains. Under the leadership of Rogier van den Berg the Department of Urbanism has been ranked twice best Master in Urbanism in the Netherlands.
